ratings.comment: Dan Fuller's class is very easy.  I read the book for his class initially but soon found that I did not need to anymore.   He covers all the material in class and everything on the two weekly reading quizzes.  Test are all memorization but he tells the class all that will be on the test.

Fuller is a passionate professor.  You can tell he truly cares about what he's teaching.  Honestly the class is super easy IF YOU STUDY for the midterm and final.  He gives you all the topics to know.  Just really study for the final and mid term.  If you study a good amount the tests are easy.  If you don't study fort the tests you WILL fail.

This class is super easy and straightforward. All you have to do is come to class, read the book (which he writes), take the quizzes (you get two chances), and memorize stuff for the tests. If you actually read the book and just memorize the pictures you should get an easy A. He's also super into photography and I love it!

The class is very boring. The exams are worth 25% an 35% and are extremely hard. You have to memorize over 100 pictures for each, who took them, and who is in them, and thats not even including the random facts you have to memorize in the hundreds. The lectures are long an boring and attendance is taken. Overall, Dan is nice, the class just sucks.

You either get an AB - A in this class, or you bomb it. It all depends on how much you study. Tests are multiple choice, so the details are important, but if you show up and do the online quizzes, you're halfway there.
The man is hilarious. Exams are kind of tough if you don't memorize everything. Overall a wonderful professor.

He seems like a very nice guy and he is very interested in photography but the lectures are awful. He'll just like there and stare at a picture in silence for a minutes. Also, the tests are pretty tough. You need to know every little detail. This class isn't an easy A, so if that's what you are looking for then don't take it.

A very likeable guy who is really funny and knowledgable, but lectures can be so slow. Grade based on two exams, attendance and weekly online quizzes that are no problem. The exams are easy if you make sure you know everything/one on the review list, which is time consuming but it puts your grade in your own hands.
Entertaining old guy who clearly loves photography. Mandatory attendance and online reading quizzes every week. 2 exams, both are pretty easy if you study hard, just a lot of photos and names
Really passionate about what he teaches and gives entertaining lectures but readings are absolutely pointless.

I would suggest to only take this class if you are interested in photography. Dan is a good lecturer, but the material he's responsible for isn't always the most entertaining. The tests are straight memorization, but he tells you everything on it. In short, if you like photography, you will like this class; if you don't, you will hate it.
Can be a really easy class but you HAVE to attend (or at least sign in) because attendance in 20% of the grade and his grading scale is weird.

Humorous but not a great lecturer. The class itself was relatively boring but requires little out of class work.Tests are strictly asking you to memorize images and random facts and are essentially easy to pass. It is easy to earn a good grade but you will learn very little from this instructor.

Entertaining and friendly but terrible lecturer.I found it almost impossible to take coherent notes from him, but he posts notes online that are practically another book, so you can get the information. Tests are lots of little details, but if you study the notes, you will be fine. Takes attendance, or else lecture would be practically unnecessary

The lectures are usually entertaining.  The class isn't hard but his lectures are difficult to follow and take notes on.  The exams include a lot of trivial facts that didn't necessarily seem pertinent in class, more along the lines of one of his flighty sidetracked thoughts.  A good guy overall but not a good lecturer if you like organized notes.

Amazing professor! Hilarious speaker, incredibly passionate, and he always wears old military uniforms. Extremely knowledgeable, and he gives in depth study guides for the midterm and final (the only grades in the class.) A must take! I wish he was my grandfather.

EASY class...yet if you're not 100% interested it can be dreadfully boring (i fall asleep in nearly all the mandatory lectures)... but with nearly no outside work, and online notes provided, and study guides....if you don't get an A, its not his fault.  He's also pretty entertaining, funny and very sarcastic.

Easy course, easier exams. Midterm exam 58% of the class scored an A or AB, if you attend class and study, you will be fine.  Gave many suggestions on how to prepare, and told you who would be on the exam.  The course is interesting, and he is a very funny and entertaining guy.
Fuller is an amazing teacher, his lectures are always exciting and interesting.  Fourth credit is always definitely worth it!
Awesome class, awesome guy.  Very easy class, but fascinating

his exams were way off the line in difficulty, and he was not helpful when asked for help in studying for his exams. there were no curves on his exams, and he is overall a horrible teacher and unfair grader.
